displayName: Brick: A uniform metadata schema for buildings
description:
Brick is an open-source effort to standardize semantic descriptions of the physical, logical and virtual assets in buildings and the relationships between them.  Brick consists of an extensible dictionary of terms and concepts in and around buildings, a set of relationships for linking and composing concepts together, and a flexible data model permitting seamless integration of Brick with existing tools and databases.  Through the use of powerful Semantic Web technology, Brick can describe the broad set of idiosyncratic and custom features, assets and subsystems found across the building stock in a consistent matter.

Adopting Brick as the canonical description of a building enables the following:

- Brick lowers the cost of deploying analytics, energy efficiency measures and intelligent controls across buildings
- Brick presents an integrated, cross-vendor representation of the multitude of subsystems in modern buildings: HVAC, lighting, fire, security and so on
- Brick simplifies the development of smart analytics and control applications
- Brick reduces the reliance upon the non-standard, unstructured labels endemic to building management systems

Brick is free and open-sourced under the BSD 3-Clause license.  The source code for Brick, this website, and related tools developed by the Brick team are available on [GitHub](https://github.com/BrickSchema).

AHU.description: Assembly consisting of sections containing a fan or fans and other necessary equipment to perform one or more of the following functions: circulating, filtration, heating, cooling, heat recovery, humidifying, dehumidifying, and mixing of air. Is usually connected to an air-distribution system.

Ablutions_Room.description: A room for performing cleansing rituals before prayer

Absorption_Chiller.description: A chiller that utilizes a thermal or/and chemical process to produce the refrigeration effect necessary to provide chilled water. There is no mechanical compression of the refrigerant taking place within the machine, as occurs within more traditional vapor compression type chillers.

Active_Energy.label: Active_Energy
Active_Energy.description: The integral of the active power over a time interval

Active_Power.description: (Active Power) is, under periodic conditions, the mean value, taken over one period (T), of the instantaneous power (p). In complex notation, (P = Re \; S), where (S) is (complex power)".

Active_Power_Sensor.description: Measures the portion of power that, averaged over a complete cycle of the AC waveform, results in net transfer of energy in one direction

Adjust_Sensor.description: Measures user-provided adjustment of some value

Air.description: the invisible gaseous substance surrounding the earth, a mixture mainly of oxygen and nitrogen.

Air_Differential_Pressure_Sensor.description: Measures the difference in pressure between two regions of air

Air_Differential_Pressure_Setpoint.description: Sets the target air differential pressure between an upstream and downstream point in a air duct or conduit

Air_Diffuser.description: A device that is a component of the air distribution system that controls the delivery of conditioned and/or ventilating air into a room

Air_Enthalpy_Sensor.description: Measures the total heat content of air

Air_Flow_Deadband_Setpoint.description: Sets the size of a deadband of air flow

Air_Flow_Demand_Setpoint.description: Sets the rate of air flow required for a process

Air_Flow_Loss_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates loss in air flow.

Air_Flow_Sensor.description: Measures the rate of flow of air

Air_Flow_Setpoint_Limit.description: A parameter that places a lower or upper bound on the range of permitted values of a Air_Flow_Setpoint.

Air_Grains_Sensor.description: Measures the mass of water vapor in air

Air_Handler_Unit.description: Assembly consisting of sections containing a fan or fans and other necessary equipment to perform one or more of the following functions: circulating, filtration, heating, cooling, heat recovery, humidifying, dehumidifying, and mixing of air. Is usually connected to an air-distribution system.

Air_Loop.description: The set of connected equipment serving one path of air

Air_Plenum.description: A component of the HVAC the receives air from the air handling unit or room to distribute or exhaust to or from the building

Air_Quality_Sensor.description: A sensor which provides a measure of air quality

Air_System.description: The equipment, distribution systems and terminals that introduce or exhaust, either collectively or individually, the air into and from the building

Air_Temperature_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates the off-normal conditions associated with the temperature of air.

Air_Temperature_Setpoint_Limit.description: A parameter that places a lower or upper bound on the range of permitted values of a Air_Temperature_Setpoint.

Alarm.description: Alarm points are signals (either audible or visual) that alert an operator to an off-normal condition which requires some form of corrective action

Alarm_Delay_Parameter.description: A parameter determining how long to delay an alarm after sufficient conditions have been met

Alternating_Current_Frequency.label: Alternating_Current_Frequency
Alternating_Current_Frequency.description: The frequency of the oscillations of alternating current

Angle.description: The inclination to each other of two intersecting lines, measured by the arc of a circle intercepted between the two lines forming the angle, the center of the circle being the point of intersection.  An acute angle is less than (90^\circ), a right angle (90^\circ); an obtuse angle, more than (90^\circ) but less than (180^\circ); a straight angle, (180^\circ); a reflex angle, more than (180^\circ) but less than (360^\circ); a perigon, (360^\circ). Any angle not a multiple of (90^\circ) is an oblique angle. If the sum of two angles is (90^\circ), they are complementary angles; if (180^\circ), supplementary angles; if (360^\circ), explementary angles.

Angle_Sensor.description: Measues the planar angle of some phenomenon

Apparent_Energy.label: Apparent_Energy
Apparent_Energy.description: The integral of the apparent power over a time interval

Apparent_Power.description: Apparent Power is the product of the rms voltage (U) between the terminals of a two-terminal element or two-terminal circuit and the rms electric current I in the element or circuit. Under sinusoidal conditions, the apparent power is the modulus of the complex power.

Atmospheric_Pressure.description: The pressure exerted by the weight of the air above it at any point on the earth's surface. At sea level the atmosphere will support a column of mercury about (760 mm) high. This decreases with increasing altitude. The standard value for the atmospheric pressure at sea level in SI units is (101,325 pascals).

Auditorium.description: A space for performances or larger gatherings

Automatic_Mode_Command.description: Controls whether or not a device or controller is operating in "Automatic" mode

Availability_Status.description: Indicates if a piece of equipment, system, or functionality is available for operation

Average_Cooling_Demand_Sensor.description: Measures the average power consumed by a cooling process as the amount of power consumed over some interval

Average_Discharge_Air_Flow_Sensor.description: The computed average flow of discharge air over some interval

Average_Exhaust_Air_Static_Pressure_Sens.description: The computed average static pressure of air in exhaust regions of an HVAC system over some period of time

Average_Heating_Demand_Sensor.description: Measures the average power consumed by a heating process as the amount of power consumed over some interval

Average_Supply_Air_Flow_Sensor.description: The computed average flow of supply air over some interval

Average_Zone_Air_Temperature_Sensor.description: The computed average temperature of air in a zone, over some period of time

Baseboard_Radiator.description: Steam, hydronic, or electric heating device located at or near the floor.

Basement.description: The floor of a building which is partly or entirely below ground level.

Battery.description: A container that stores chemical energy that can be converted into electricity and used as a source of power

Battery_Energy_Storage_System.description: A collection of batteries that provides energy storage, along with their supporting equipment

Battery_Room.description: A room used to hold batteries for backup power

Battery_Voltage_Sensor.description: Measures the capacity of a battery

Bench_Space.description: For areas of play in a stadium, the area for partcipants and referees by the side of the field

Blowdown_Water.description: Water expelled from a system to remove mineral build up

Boiler.description: A closed, pressure vessel that uses fuel or electricity for heating water or other fluids to supply steam or hot water for heating, humidification, or other applications.

Booster_Fan.description: Fan activated to increase airflow beyond what is provided by the default configuration

Break_Room.description: A space for people to relax while not working

Breaker_Panel.description: Breaker Panel distributes power into various end-uses.

Breakroom.description: A space for people to relax while not working

Broadcast_Room.description: A space to organize and manage a broadcast. Separate from studio

Building.description: An independent unit of the built environment with a characteristic spatial structure, intended to serve at least one function or user activity [ISO 12006-2:2013]

Building_Air_Humidity_Setpoint.description: Setpoint for humidity in a building

Building_Air_Static_Pressure_Sensor.description: The static pressure of air within a building

Building_Air_Static_Pressure_Setpoint.description: Sets static pressure of the entire building

Building_Chilled_Water_Meter.description: A meter that measures the usage or consumption of chilled water of a whole building

Building_Electrical_Meter.description: A meter that measures the usage or consumption of electricity of a whole building

Building_Gas_Meter.description: A meter that measures the usage or consumption of gas of a whole building

Building_Hot_Water_Meter.description: A meter that measures the usage or consumption of hot water of a whole building

Building_Meter.description: A meter that measures usage or consumption of some media for a whole building

Building_Water_Meter.description: A meter that measures the usage or consumption of water of a whole building

Bus_Riser.description: Bus Risers are commonly fed from a switchgear and rise up through a series of floors to the main power distribution source for each floor.

Bypass_Air.description: air in a bypass duct, used to relieve static pressure

Bypass_Air_Flow_Sensor.description: Measures the rate of flow of bypass air

Bypass_Valve.description: A type of valve installed in a bypass pipeline

Bypass_Water.description: Water that circumvents a piece of equipment or system

Bypass_Water_Flow_Sensor.description: Measures the rate of flow of bypass water

Bypass_Water_Flow_Setpoint.description: Sets the target flow rate of bypass water

CO.description: Carbon Monoxide in the vapor phase

CO2.description: Carbon Dioxide in the vapor phase

CO2_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates the off-normal conditions associated with the presence of carbon dioxide.

CO2_Concentration.label: CO2Concentration
CO2_Concentration.description: The concentration of carbon dioxide in a medium

CO2_Differential_Sensor.description: Measures the difference between CO2 levels of inside and outside air

CO2_Level_Sensor.description: Measures the concentration of CO2 in air

CO2_Sensor.description: Measures properties of CO2 in air

CO_Concentration.label: COConcentration
CO_Concentration.description: The concentration of carbon monoxide in a medium

Cafeteria.description: A space to serve food and beverages

Ceiling_Fan.description: A fan installed on the ceiling of a room for the purpose of air circulation

Centrifugal_Chiller.description: A chiller that uses the vapor compression cycle to chill water. It throws off the heat collected from the chilled water plus the heat from the compressor to a water loop

Change_Filter_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates that a filter must be changed

Chilled_Water.description: water used as a cooling medium (particularly in air-conditioning systems or in processes) at below ambient temperature.

Chilled_Water_Coil.description: A cooling element made of pipe or tube that removes heat from equipment, machines or airflows that is filled with chilled water.

Chilled_Water_Differential_Pressure_Dead.description: Sets the size of a deadband of differential pressure of chilled water

Chilled_Water_Differential_Pressure_Sens.description: Measures the difference in water pressure on either side of a chilled water valve

Chilled_Water_Differential_Pressure_Setp.description: Sets the target water differential pressure between an upstream and downstream point in a water pipe or conduit used to carry chilled water

Chilled_Water_Differential_Temperature_S.description: Measures the difference in temperature between the entering water to the chiller or other water cooling device and leaving water from the same chiller or other water cooling device

Chilled_Water_Discharge_Flow_Sensor.description: Measures the rate of flow of chilled discharge water

Chilled_Water_Discharge_Flow_Setpoint.description: Sets the target flow rate of chilled discharge water

Chilled_Water_Flow_Sensor.description: Measures the rate of flow in a chilled water circuit

Chilled_Water_Flow_Setpoint.description: Sets the target flow rate of chilled water

Chilled_Water_Loop.description: A collection of equipment that transport and regulate chilled water among each other

Chilled_Water_Meter.description: A meter that measures the usage or consumption of chilled water

Chilled_Water_Pump.description: A pump that performs work on chilled water; typically part of a chilled water system

Chilled_Water_Pump_Differential_Pressure.description: Sets the size of a deadband of differential pressure of chilled water in a chilled water pump

Chilled_Water_Return_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the temperature of chilled water that is returned to a cooling tower

Chilled_Water_Static_Pressure_Setpoint.description: Sets static pressure of chilled water

Chilled_Water_Supply_Flow_Sensor.description: Measures the rate of flow of chilled supply water

Chilled_Water_Supply_Flow_Setpoint.description: Sets the target flow rate of chilled supply water

Chilled_Water_Supply_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the temperature of chilled water that is supplied from a chiller

Chilled_Water_System.description: The equipment, devices and conduits that handle the production and distribution of chilled water in a building

Chilled_Water_System_Enable_Command.description: Enables operation of the chilled water system

Chilled_Water_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the temperature of chilled water

Chilled_Water_Temperature_Setpoint.description: Sets the temperature of chilled water

Chilled_Water_Valve.description: A valve that modulates the flow of chilled water

Chiller.description: Refrigerating machine used to transfer heat between fluids. Chillers are either direct expansion with a compressor or absorption type.

Close_Limit.description: A parameter that places a lower or upper bound on the range of permitted values of a Close_Setpoint.

Cloudage.label: Cloudage
Cloudage.description: The fraction of the sky obscured by clouds when observed from a particular location

Coil.description: Cooling or heating element made of pipe or tube that may or may not be finned and formed into helical or serpentine shape (ASHRAE Dictionary)

Cold_Box.description: in a gas separation unit, the insulated section that contains the low-temperature heat exchangers and distillation columns.

Coldest_Zone_Air_Temperature_Sensor.description: The zone temperature that is coldest; drives the supply temperature of hot air. A computed value rather than a physical sensor. Also referred to as a 'Lowest Zone Air Temperature Sensor'

Collection_Basin_Water.description: Water transiently collected and directed to the sump or pump suction line, typically integral with a cooling tower

Collection_Basin_Water_Heater.description: Basin heaters prevent cold water basin freeze-up, e.g. in cooling towers, closed circuit fluid coolers, or evaporative condensers

Collection_Basin_Water_Level_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates a high or low level of water in the collection basin, e.g. within a Cooling_Tower

Collection_Basin_Water_Level_Sensor.description: Measures the level of the water in the collection basin, e.g. within a Cooling_Tower

Collection_Basin_Water_Temperature_Senso.description: Measures the temperature of the water in the collection basin, e.g. within a Cooling_Tower

Command.description: A Command is an output point that directly determines the behavior of equipment and/or affects relevant operational points.

Common_Space.description: A class of spaces that are used by multiple people at the same time

Communication_Loss_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates a loss of communication e.g. with a device or controller

Complex_Power.description: Complex Power, under sinusoidal conditions, is the product of the phasor (U) representing the voltage between the terminals of a linear two-terminal element or two-terminal circuit and the complex conjugate of the phasor (I) representing the electric current in the element or circuit.

Compressor.description: (1) device for mechanically increasing the pressure of a gas. (2) often described as being either open, hermetic, or semihermetic to describe how the compressor and motor drive is situated in relation to the gas or vapor being compressed. Types include centrifugal, axial flow, reciprocating, rotary screw, rotary vane, scroll, or diaphragm. 1. device for mechanically increasing the pressure of a gas. 2. specific machine, with or without accessories, for compressing refrigerant vapor.

Computer_Room_Air_Conditioning.description: A device that monitors and maintains the temperature, air distribution and humidity in a network room or data center.

Concession.description: A space to sell food and beverages. Usually embedded in a larger space and does not include a space where people consume their purchases

Condensate_Leak_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates a leak of condensate from a cooling system

Condenser.description: A heat exchanger in which the primary heat transfer vapor changes its state to a liquid phase.

Condenser_Heat_Exchanger.description: A heat exchanger in which the primary heat transfer vapor changes its state to a liquid phase.

Condenser_Water.description: Water used used to remove heat through condensation

Condenser_Water_Bypass_Valve.description: A valve installed in a bypass line of a condenser water loop

Condenser_Water_Isolation_Valve.description: An isolation valve installed in the condenser water loop

Condenser_Water_Pump.description: A pump that is part of a condenser system; the pump circulates condenser water from the chiller back to the cooling tower

Condenser_Water_System.description: A heat rejection system consisting of (typically) cooling towers, condenser water pumps, chillers and the piping connecting the components

Condenser_Water_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the temperature of condenser water

Condenser_Water_Valve.description: A valve that modulates the flow of condenser water

Condensing_Natural_Gas_Boiler.description: A closed, pressure vessel that uses natural gas and heat exchanger that capture and reuse any latent heat for heating water or other fluids to supply steam or hot water for heating, humidification, or other applications.

Conference_Room.description: A space dedicated in which to hold a meetings

Constant_Air_Volume_Box.description: A terminal unit for which supply air flow rate is constant and the supply air temperature is varied to meet thermal load

Contact_Sensor.description: Senses or detects contact, such as for determining if a door is closed.

Control_Room.description: A space from which operations are managed

Cooling_Coil.description: A cooling element made of pipe or tube that removes heat from equipment, machines or airflows. Typically filled with either refrigerant or cold water.

Cooling_Command.description: Controls the amount of cooling to be delivered (typically as a proportion of total cooling output)

Cooling_Demand_Sensor.description: Measures the amount of power consumed by a cooling process; typically found by multiplying the tonnage of a unit (e.g. RTU) by the efficiency rating in kW/ton

Cooling_Demand_Setpoint.description: Sets the rate required for cooling

Cooling_Discharge_Air_Flow_Setpoint.description: Sets discharge air flow for cooling

Cooling_Discharge_Air_Temperature_Deadba.description: Sets the size of a deadband of temperature of cooling discharge air

Cooling_Supply_Air_Flow_Setpoint.description: Sets supply air flow rate for cooling

Cooling_Supply_Air_Temperature_Deadband_.description: Sets the size of a deadband of temperature of supply air for cooling

Cooling_Tower.description: A cooling tower is a heat rejection device that rejects waste heat to the atmosphere through the cooling of a water stream to a lower temperature. Cooling towers may either use the evaporation of water to remove process heat and cool the working fluid to near the wet-bulb air temperature or, in the case of closed circuit dry cooling towers, rely solely on air to cool the working fluid to near the dry-bulb air temperature.

Cooling_Tower_Fan.description: A fan that pulls air through a cooling tower and across the louvers where the water falls to aid in heat exchange by the process of evaporation

Cooling_Valve.description: A valve that controls air temperature by modulating the amount of cold water flowing through a cooling coil

Copy_Room.description: A room set aside for common office equipment, including printers and copiers

Core_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the internal temperature of the radiant layer at the heat source or sink level of the radiant heating and cooling HVAC system.

Core_Temperature_Setpoint.description: Sets temperature for the core, i.e. the temperature at the heat source or sink level, of the radiant panel.

Cubicle.description: A smaller space set aside for an individual, but not with a door and without full-height walls

Current_Imbalance.label: CurrentImbalance
Current_Imbalance.description: The percent deviation from average current

Current_Imbalance_Sensor.description: A sensor which measures the current difference (imbalance) between phases of an electrical system

Current_Limit.description: A parameter that places a lower or upper bound on the range of permitted values of a Current_Setpoint.

Current_Output_Sensor.description: Senses the amperes of electrical current produced as output by a device

Current_Sensor.description: Senses the amperes of electrical current passing through the sensor

Current_Total_Harmonic_Distortion.label: CurrentTotalHarmonicDistortion
Current_Total_Harmonic_Distortion.description: Measurement of harmonic distortion present in a signal defined as the sum of the powers of all harmonic components to the power of the fundamental frequency. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Total_harmonic_distortion)

Cycle_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates off-normal conditions associated with HVAC cycles

DC_Bus_Voltage_Sensor.description: Measures the voltage across a DC bus

Damper.description: Element inserted into an air-distribution system or element of an air-distribution system permitting modification of the air resistance of the system and consequently changing the airflow rate or shutting off the airflow.

Damper_Position_Command.description: Controls the position (the degree of openness) of a damper

Damper_Position_Sensor.description: Measures the current position of a damper in terms of the percent of fully open

Database.description: A database storing the timeseries data for the related point. Properties on this class are *to be determined*; feel free to add arbitrary properties onto Database instances for your particular deployment

Deadband_Setpoint.description: Sets the size of a deadband

Dedicated_Outdoor_Air_System_Unit.description: A device that conditions and delivers 100% outdoor air to its assigned spaces. It decouples air-conditioning of the outdoor air, usually used to provide minimum outdoor air ventilation, from conditioning of the internal loads.

Deionised_Water_Conductivity_Sensor.description: Measures the electrical conductance of deionised water

Deionised_Water_Level_Sensor.description: Measures the height/level of deionised water in some container

Deionized_Water.description: Water which has been purified by removing its ions (constituting the majority of non-particulate contaminants)

Deionized_Water_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates deionized water leaks.

Delay_Parameter.description: A parameter determining how long to delay a subsequent action to take place after a received signal

Demand_Sensor.description: Measures the amount of power consumed by the use of some process; typically found by multiplying the tonnage of a unit (e.g. RTU) by the efficiency rating in kW/ton

Demand_Setpoint.description: Sets the rate required for a process

Detention_Room.description: A space for the temporary involuntary confinement of people

Dewpoint_Sensor.description: Senses the dewpoint temperature . Dew point is the temperature to which air must be cooled to become saturated with water vapor

Differential_CO2_Concentration.label: ΔCO2Concentration
Differential_CO2_Concentration.description: The difference in carbon dioxide concentration between two areas

Differential_CO_Concentration.label: ΔCOConcentration
Differential_CO_Concentration.description: The difference in carbon monoxide concentration between two areas

Differential_Pressure_Bypass_Valve.description: A 2-way, self contained proportional valve with an integral differential pressure adjustment setting.

Differential_Pressure_Deadband_Setpoint.description: Sets the size of a deadband of differential pressure

Differential_Pressure_Sensor.description: Measures the difference between two applied pressures

Differential_Pressure_Setpoint_Limit.description: A parameter that places a lower or upper bound on the range of permitted values of a Differential_Pressure_Setpoint.

Differential_Supply_Return_Water_Tempera.description: Measures the difference in temperature between return and supply water of water a circuit

Dimmer.description: A switch providing continuous control over all or part of a lighting installation; typically potentiometer-based

Direction_Command.description: Commands that affect the direction of some phenomenon

Direction_Sensor.description: Measures the direction in degrees in which a phenomenon is occuring

Direction_Status.description: Indicates which direction a device is operating in

Disable_Differential_Enthalpy_Command.description: Disables the use of differential enthalpy control

Disable_Differential_Temperature_Command.description: Disables the use of differential temperature control

Disable_Fixed_Enthalpy_Command.description: Disables the use of fixed enthalpy control

Disable_Fixed_Temperature_Command.description: Disables the use of fixed temperature temperature

Disable_Hot_Water_System_Outside_Air_Tem.description: Disables hot water system when outside air temperature reaches the indicated value

Disable_Status.description: Indicates if functionality has been disabled

Discharge_Air_Duct_Pressure_Status.description: Indicates if air pressure in discharge duct is within expected bounds

Discharge_Air_Flow_Demand_Setpoint.description: Sets the rate of discharge air flow required for a process

Discharge_Air_Flow_Sensor.description: Measures the rate of flow of discharge air

Discharge_Air_Humidity_Sensor.description: Measures the relative humidity of discharge air

Discharge_Air_Static_Pressure_Deadband_S.description: Sets the size of a deadband of static pressure of discharge air

Discharge_Air_Static_Pressure_Sensor.description: The static pressure of air within discharge regions of an HVAC system

Discharge_Air_Static_Pressure_Setpoint.description: Sets static pressure of discharge air

Discharge_Air_Temperature_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates the off-normal conditions associated with the temperature of discharge air.

Discharge_Air_Temperature_Cooling_Setpoi.description: Sets temperature of discharge air for cooling

Discharge_Air_Temperature_Deadband_Setpo.description: Sets the size of a deadband of temperature of discharge air

Discharge_Air_Temperature_Heating_Setpoi.description: Sets temperature of discharge air for heating

Discharge_Air_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the temperature of discharge air

Discharge_Air_Temperature_Setpoint_Limit.description: A parameter that places a lower or upper bound on the range of permitted values of a Discharge_Air_Temperature_Setpoint.

Discharge_Fan.description: Fan moving air discharged from HVAC vents

Discharge_Water_Differential_Pressure_De.description: Sets the size of a deadband of differential pressure of discharge water

Discharge_Water_Flow_Sensor.description: Measures the rate of flow of discharge water

Discharge_Water_Flow_Setpoint.description: Sets the target flow rate of discharge water

Discharge_Water_Temperature_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates the off-normal conditions associated with temperature of the discharge water.

Discharge_Water_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the temperature of discharge water

Disconnect_Switch.description: Building power is most commonly provided by utility company through a master disconnect switch (sometimes called a service disconnect) in the main electrical room of a building. The Utility Company provided master disconnect switch often owns or restricts access to this switch. There can also be other cases where a disconnect is placed into an electrical system to allow service cut-off to a portion of the building.

Displacement_Flow_Air_Diffuser.description: An air diffuser that is designed for low discharge air speeds to minimize turbulence and induction of room air. This diffuser is used with displacement ventilation systems.

Distribution_Frame.description: A class of spaces where the cables carrying signals meet and connect, e.g. a wiring closet or a broadcast downlink room

Domestic_Hot_Water_Supply_Temperature_Se.description: Measures the temperature of domestic water supplied by a hot water system
Sets temperature of supplying part of domestic hot water

Domestic_Hot_Water_System.description: The equipment, devices and conduits that handle the production and distribution of domestic hot water in a building

Domestic_Hot_Water_System_Enable_Command.description: Enables operation of the domestic hot water system

Domestic_Hot_Water_Temperature_Setpoint.description: Sets temperature of domestic hot water

Domestic_Hot_Water_Valve.description: A valve regulating the flow of domestic hot water

Domestic_Water.description: A collection of equipment that transport and regulate domestic water among each other

Drive_Ready_Status.description: Indicates if a hard drive or other storage device is ready to be used, e.g. in the context of RAID

Dry_Bulb_Temperature.label: Dry_Bulb_Temperature
Dry_Bulb_Temperature.description: The temperature of air measured by a thermometer freely exposed to the air, but shielded from radiation and moisture. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dry-bulb_temperature)

Duration_Sensor.description: Measures the duration of a phenomenon or event

Economizer.description: Device that, on proper variable sensing, initiates control signals or actions to conserve energy. A control system that reduces the mechanical heating and cooling requirement.

Economizer_Damper.description: A damper that is part of an economizer that is used to module the flow of air

Electric_Baseboard_Radiator.description: Electric heating device located at or near the floor

Electric_Boiler.description: A closed, pressure vessel that uses electricity for heating water or other fluids to supply steam or hot water for heating, humidification, or other applications.

Electric_Energy.label: ElectricEnergy
Electric_Energy.description: A form of energy resulting from the flow of electrical charge

Electric_Power.description: Electric Power is the rate at which electrical energy is transferred by an electric circuit. In the simple case of direct current circuits, electric power can be calculated as the product of the potential difference in the circuit (V) and the amount of current flowing in the circuit (I): (P = VI), where (P) is the power, (V) is the potential difference, and (I) is the current. However, in general electric power is calculated by taking the integral of the vector cross-product of the electrical and magnetic fields over a specified area.

Electrical_Meter.description: A meter that measures the usage or consumption of electricity

Electrical_Power_Sensor.description: Measures the amount of instantaneous electric power consumed

Electrical_Room.description: A class of service rooms that house electrical equipment for a building

Electrical_System.description: Devices that serve or are part of the electrical subsystem in the building

Elevator.description: A device that provides vertical transportation between floors, levels or decks of a building, vessel or other structure

Elevator_Shaft.description: The vertical space in which an elevator ascends and descends

Elevator_Space.description: The vertical space in whcih an elevator ascends and descends

Embedded_Surface_System_Panel.description: Radiant panel heating and cooling system where the energy heat source or sink is embedded in a radiant layer which is thermally insulated from the building structure.

Embedded_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the internal temperature of the radiant layer of the radiant heating and cooling HVAC system.

Embedded_Temperature_Setpoint.description: Sets temperature for the internal material, e.g. concrete slab, of the radiant panel.

Emergency_Alarm.description: Alarms that indicate off-normal conditions associated with emergency systems

Emergency_Generator_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates off-normal conditions associated with an emergency generator

Emergency_Generator_Status.description: Indicates if an emergency generator is active

Emergency_Power_Off_System.description: A system that can power down a single piece of equipment or a single system from a single point

Emergency_Push_Button_Status.description: Indicates if an emergency button has been pushed

Employee_Entrance_Lobby.description: An open space near an entrance that is typicaly only used for employees

Enable_Differential_Enthalpy_Command.description: Enables the use of differential enthalpy control

Enable_Differential_Temperature_Command.description: Enables the use of differential temperature control

Enable_Fixed_Enthalpy_Command.description: Enables the use of fixed enthalpy control

Enable_Fixed_Temperature_Command.description: Enables the use of fixed temperature control

Enable_Hot_Water_System_Outside_Air_Temp.description: Enables hot water system when outside air temperature reaches the indicated value

Enable_Status.description: Indicates if a system or piece of functionality has been enabled

Enclosed_Office.description: A space for individuals to work with walls and a door

Energy_Generation_System.description: A collection of devices that generates electricity

Energy_Storage.description: Devices or equipment that store energy in its various forms

Energy_Storage_System.description: A collection of devices that stores electricity

Energy_System.description: A collection of devices that generates, stores or transports electricity

Energy_Usage_Sensor.description: Measures the total amount of energy used over some period of time

Energy_Zone.description: A space or group of spaces that are managed or monitored as one unit for energy purposes

Entering_Water.description: Water that is entering a piece of equipment or system

Entering_Water_Flow_Sensor.description: Measures the rate of flow of water entering a piece of equipment or system

Entering_Water_Flow_Setpoint.description: Sets the target flow rate of entering water

Entering_Water_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the temperature of water entering a piece of equipment or system

Enthalpy.description: (also known as heat content), thermodynamic quantity equal to the sum of the internal energy of a system plus the product of the pressure volume work done on the system. H = E + pv, where H = enthalpy or total heat content, E = internal energy of the system, p = pressure, and v = volume. (Compare to [[specific enthalpy]].)

Enthalpy_Sensor.description: Measures the total heat content of some substance

Entrance.description: The location and space of a building where people enter and exit the building

Environment_Box.description: (also known as climatic chamber), enclosed space designed to create a particular environment.

Equipment.description: devices that serve all or part of the building and may include electric power, lighting, transportation, or service water heating, including, but not limited to, furnaces, boilers, air conditioners, heat pumps, chillers, water heaters, lamps, luminaires, ballasts, elevators, escalators, or other devices or installations.

Equipment_Room.description: A telecommunications room where equipment that serves the building is stored

Exercise_Room.description: An indoor room used for exercise and physical activities

Exhaust_Air.description: air that must be removed from a space due to contaminants, regardless of pressurization

Exhaust_Air_Differential_Pressure_Sensor.description: Measures the difference in pressure between an upstream and downstream of an air duct or other air conduit used to exhaust air from the building

Exhaust_Air_Differential_Pressure_Setpoi.description: Sets the target air differential pressure between an upstream and downstream point in a exhaust air duct or conduit

Exhaust_Air_Flow_Sensor.description: Measures the rate of flow of exhaust air

Exhaust_Air_Humidity_Sensor.description: Measures the relative humidity of exhaust air

Exhaust_Air_Stack_Flow_Deadband_Setpoint.description: Sets the size of a deadband of exhaust air stack flow

Exhaust_Air_Stack_Flow_Sensor.description: Measures the rate of flow of air in the exhaust air stack

Exhaust_Air_Stack_Flow_Setpoint.description: Sets exhaust air stack flow rate

Exhaust_Air_Static_Pressure_Sensor.description: The static pressure of air within exhaust regions of an HVAC system

Exhaust_Air_Static_Pressure_Setpoint.description: Sets static pressure of exhaust air

Exhaust_Air_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the temperature of exhaust air

Exhaust_Damper.description: A damper that modulates the flow of exhaust air

Exhaust_Fan.description: Fan moving exhaust air -- air that must be removed from a space due to contaminants

Exhaust_Fan_Disable_Command.description: Disables operation of the exhaust fan

Exhaust_Fan_Enable_Command.description: Enables operation of the exhaust fan

Failure_Alarm.description: Alarms that indicate the failure of devices, equipment, systems and control loops

Fan.description: Any device with two or more blades or vanes attached to a rotating shaft used to produce an airflow for the purpose of comfort, ventilation, exhaust, heating, cooling, or any other gaseous transport.

Fan_Coil_Unit.description: Terminal device consisting of a heating and/or cooling heat exchanger or 'coil' and fan that is used to control the temperature in the space where it is installed

Fault_Status.description: Indicates the presence of a fault in a device, system or control loop

Field_Of_Play.description: The area of a stadium where athletic events occur, e.g. the soccer pitch

Filter.description: Device to remove gases from a mixture of gases or to remove solid material from a fluid

Filter_Differential_Pressure_Sensor.description: Measures the difference in pressure on either side of a filter

Filter_Status.description: Indicates if a filter needs to be replaced

Final_Filter.description: The last, high-efficiency filter installed in a sequence to remove the finest particulates from the substance being filtered

Fire_Control_Panel.description: A panel-mounted device that provides status and control of a fire safety system

Fire_Safety_System.description: A system containing devices and equipment that monitor, detect and suppress fire hazards

Fire_Zone.description: combustion chamber in a furnace or boiler.

First_Aid_Room.description: A room for a person with minor injuries can be treated or temporarily treated until transferred to a more advanced medical facility

Floor.description: A level, typically representing a horizontal aggregation of spaces that are vertically bound. (referring to IFC)

Flow_Loss.label: FlowLoss
Flow_Loss.description: The amount of flow rate that is lost during distribution

Flow_Sensor.description: Measures the rate of flow of some substance

Fluid.description: substance, as a liquid or gas, that is capable of flowing and that changes shape when acted on by a force.

Food_Service_Room.description: A space used in the production, storage, serving, or cleanup of food and beverages

Formaldehyde_Concentration.label: FormaldehydeConcentration
Formaldehyde_Concentration.description: The concentration of formaldehyde in a medium

Formaldehyde_Level_Sensor.description: Measures the concentration of formaldehyde in air

Freeze_Status.description: Indicates if a substance contained within a vessel has frozen

Freezer.description: cold chamber usually kept at a temperature of 22°F to 31°F (–5°C to –1°C), with high-volume air circulation.

Frequency.description: Frequency is the number of occurrences of a repeating event per unit time. The repetition of the events may be periodic (that is. the length of time between event repetitions is fixed) or aperiodic (i.e. the length of time between event repetitions varies). Therefore, we distinguish between periodic and aperiodic frequencies. In the SI system, periodic frequency is measured in hertz (Hz) or multiples of hertz, while aperiodic frequency is measured in becquerel (Bq).  In spectroscopy, ( u) is mostly used. Light passing through different media keeps its frequency, but not its wavelength or wavenumber.

Frequency_Command.description: Controls the frequency of a device's operation (e.g. rotational frequency)

Frequency_Sensor.description: Measures the frequency of a phenomenon or aspect of a phenomenon, e.g. the frequency of a fan turning

Fresh_Air_Fan.description: Fan moving fresh air -- air that is supplied into the building from the outdoors

Fresh_Air_Setpoint_Limit.description: A parameter that places a lower or upper bound on the range of permitted values of a Fresh_Air_Setpoint.

Frost.description: frost formed on the cold surface (tubes, plates) of a cooling coil.

Frost_Sensor.description: Senses the presence of frost or conditions that may cause frost

Fuel_Oil.description: Petroleum based oil burned for energy

Fume_Hood.description: A fume-collection device mounted over a work space, table, or shelf and serving to conduct unwanted gases away from the area enclosed.

Fume_Hood_Air_Flow_Sensor.description: Measures the rate of flow of air in a fume hood

Furniture.description: Movable objects intended to support various human activities such as seating, eating and sleeping

Gas.description: state of matter in which substances exist in the form of nonaggregated molecules and which, within acceptable limits of accuracy, satisfy the ideal gas laws; usually a highly superheated vapor. See [[state]].

Gas_Distribution.description: Utilize a gas distribution source to represent how gas is distributed across multiple destinations

Gas_Meter.description: A meter that measures the usage or consumption of gas

Gasoline.description: Petroleum derived liquid used as a fuel source

Gatehouse.description: The standalone building used to manage the entrance to a campus or building grounds

Generator_Room.description: A room for electrical equipment, specifically electrical generators.

GrainsOfMoisture.label: GrainsOfMoisture
GrainsOfMoisture.description: Mass of moisture per pround of air, measured in grains of water

HVAC_Zone.description: a space or group of spaces, within a building with heating, cooling, and ventilating requirements, that are sufficiently similar so that desired conditions (e.g., temperature) can be maintained throughout using a single sensor (e.g., thermostat or temperature sensor).

Hail.description: pellets of frozen rain which fall in showers from cumulonimbus clouds.

Hail_Sensor.description: Measures hail in terms of its size and damage potential

Hallway.description: A common space, used to connect other parts of a building

Hazardous_Materials_Storage.description: A storage space set aside (usually with restricted access) for the storage of materials that can be hazardous to living beings or the environment

Heat_Exchanger.description: A heat exchanger is a piece of equipment built for efficient heat transfer from one medium to another. The media may be separated by a solid wall to prevent mixing or they may be in direct contact (BEDES)

Heat_Exchanger_Supply_Water_Temperature_.description: Measures the temperature of water supplied by a heat exchanger

Heat_Exchanger_System_Enable_Status.description: Indicates if the heat exchanger system has been enabled

Heat_Wheel.description: A rotary heat exchanger positioned within the supply and exhaust air streams of an air handling system in order to recover heat energy

Heat_Wheel_VFD.description: A VFD that drives a heat wheel

Heating_Coil.description: A heating element typically made of pipe, tube or wire that emits heat. Typically filled with hot water, or, in the case of wire, uses electricity.

Heating_Command.description: Controls the amount of heating to be delivered (typically as a proportion of total heating output)

Heating_Demand_Sensor.description: Measures the amount of power consumed by a heating process; typically found by multiplying the tonnage of a unit (e.g. RTU) by the efficiency rating in kW/ton

Heating_Demand_Setpoint.description: Sets the rate required for heating

Heating_Discharge_Air_Flow_Setpoint.description: Sets discharge air flow for heating

Heating_Discharge_Air_Temperature_Deadba.description: Sets the size of a deadband of temperature of heating discharge air

Heating_Supply_Air_Flow_Setpoint.description: Sets supply air flow rate for heating

Heating_Supply_Air_Temperature_Deadband_.description: Sets the size of a deadband of temperature of supply air for heating

Heating_Valve.description: A valve that controls air temperature by modulating the amount of hot water flowing through a heating coil

Heating_Ventilation_Air_Conditioning_Sys.description: The equipment, distribution systems and terminals that provide, either collectively or individually, the processes of heating, ventilating or air conditioning to a building or portion of a building

High_CO2_Alarm.description: A device that indicates high concentration of carbon dioxide.

High_Discharge_Air_Temperature_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates that discharge air temperature is too high

High_Head_Pressure_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates a high pressure generated on the output side of a gas compressor in a refrigeration or air conditioning system.

High_Humidity_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates high concentration of water vapor in the air.

High_Humidity_Alarm_Parameter.description: A parameter determining the humidity level at which to trigger a high humidity alarm

High_Outside_Air_Lockout_Temperature_Dif.description: The upper bound of the outside air temperature lockout range

High_Return_Air_Temperature_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates that return air temperature is too high

High_Static_Pressure_Cutout_Setpoint_Lim.description: A parameter that places a lower or upper bound on the range of permitted values of a High_Static_Pressure_Cutout_Setpoint.

High_Temperature_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates high temperature.

High_Temperature_Alarm_Parameter.description: A parameter determining the temperature level at which to trigger a high temperature alarm

High_Temperature_Hot_Water_Return_Temper.description: Measures the temperature of high-temperature hot water returned to a hot water system

High_Temperature_Hot_Water_Supply_Temper.description: Measures the temperature of high-temperature hot water supplied by a hot water system

Hospitality_Box.description: A room at a stadium, usually overlooking the field of play, that is physical separate from the other seating at the venue

Hot_Box.description: hot air chamber forming part of an air handler.

Hot_Water.description: Hot water used for HVAC heating or supply to hot taps

Hot_Water_Baseboard_Radiator.description: Hydronic heating device located at or near the floor

Hot_Water_Coil.description: A heating element typically made of pipe, tube or wire that emits heat that is filled with hot water.

Hot_Water_Differential_Pressure_Deadband.description: Sets the size of a deadband of differential pressure of hot water

Hot_Water_Differential_Pressure_Sensor.description: Measures the difference in water pressure on either side of a hot water valve

Hot_Water_Differential_Pressure_Setpoint.description: Sets the target water differential pressure between an upstream and downstream point in a water pipe or conduit used to carry hot water

Hot_Water_Differential_Temperature_Senso.description: Measures the difference in temperature between the entering water to the boiler or other water heating device and leaving water from the same boiler or other water heating device

Hot_Water_Discharge_Flow_Sensor.description: Measures the rate of flow of hot discharge water

Hot_Water_Discharge_Flow_Setpoint.description: Sets the target flow rate of hot discharge water

Hot_Water_Flow_Sensor.description: Measures the rate of flow in a hot water circuit

Hot_Water_Flow_Setpoint.description: Sets the target flow rate of hot water

Hot_Water_Loop.description: A collection of equipment that transport and regulate hot water among each other

Hot_Water_Meter.description: A meter that measures the usage or consumption of hot water

Hot_Water_Pump.description: A pump that performs work on hot water; typically part of a hot water system

Hot_Water_Return_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the temperature of water returned to a hot water system

Hot_Water_Static_Pressure_Setpoint.description: Sets static pressure of hot air

Hot_Water_Supply_Flow_Sensor.description: Measures the rate of flow of hot supply water

Hot_Water_Supply_Flow_Setpoint.description: Sets the target flow rate of hot supply water

Hot_Water_Supply_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the temperature of water supplied by a hot water system

Hot_Water_System.description: The equipment, devices and conduits that handle the production and distribution of hot water in a building

Hot_Water_System_Enable_Command.description: Enables operation of the hot water system

Hot_Water_Temperature_Setpoint.description: Sets the temperature of hot water

Hot_Water_Usage_Sensor.description: Measures the amount of hot water that is consumed, over some period of time

Hot_Water_Valve.description: A valve regulating the flow of hot water

Humidifier.description: A device that adds moisture to air or other gases

Humidifier_Fault_Status.description: Indicates the presence of a fault in a humidifier

Humidity_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates the off-normal conditions associated with the concentration of water vapor in the air.

Humidity_Parameter.description: Parameters relevant to humidity-related systems and points

Humidity_Sensor.description: Measures the concentration of water vapor in air

Humidity_Tolerance_Parameter.description: A parameter determining the difference between upper and lower limits of humidity.

IDF.description: An room for an intermediate distribution frame, where cables carrying signals from the main distrubtion frame terminate and then feed out to endpoints

Ice_Tank_Leaving_Water_Temperature_Senso.description: Measures the temperature of water leaving an ice tank

Illuminance_Sensor.description: Measures the total luminous flux incident on a surface, per unit area

Imbalance_Sensor.description: A sensor which measures difference (imbalance) between phases of an electrical system

Information_Area.description: An information booth or kiosk where visitors would look for information

Inside_Face_Surface_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the inside surface (relative to the space) of the radiant panel of the radiant heating and cooling HVAC system.

Inside_Face_Surface_Temperature_Setpoint.description: Sets temperature for the inside face surface temperature of the radiant panel.

Intake_Air_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures air at the interface between the building and the outside

Interface.description: A device that provides an occupant control over a lighting system

Inverter.description: A device that changes direct current into alternating current

Irradiance.label: Irradiance
Irradiance.description: The power per unit area of electromagnetic radiation incident on a surface

Isolation_Valve.description: A valve that stops the flow of a fluid, usually for maintenance or safety purposes

Janitor_Room.description: A room set aside for the storage of cleaning equipment and supplies

Jet_Nozzle_Air_Diffuser.description: An air diffuser that is designed to produce high velocity discharge air stream to throw the air over a large distance or target the air stream to a localize area

Laboratory.description: facility acceptable to the local, national, or international recognized authority having jurisdiction and which provides uniform testing and examination procedures and standards for meeting design, manufacturing, and factory testing requirements.

Laminar_Flow_Air_Diffuser.description: An air diffuser that is designed for low discharge air speeds to provide uniform and unidirectional air pattern which minimizes room air entrainment

Last_Fault_Code_Status.description: Indicates the last fault code that occurred

Lead_Lag_Status.description: Indicates if lead/lag operation is enabled

Lead_On_Off_Command.description: Controls the active/inactive status of the "lead" part of a lead/lag system

Leak_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates leaks occured in systems containing fluids

Leaving_Water.description: Water that is leaving a piece of equipment or system

Leaving_Water_Flow_Sensor.description: Measures the rate of flow of water that is leaving a piece of equipment or system

Leaving_Water_Flow_Setpoint.description: Sets the target flow rate of leaving water

Leaving_Water_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the temperature of water leaving a piece of equipment or system

Level.label: Level
Level.description: Amount of substance in a container; typically measured in height

Library.description: A place for the storage and/or consumption of physical media, e.g. books, periodicals, and DVDs/CDs

Lighting_System.description: The equipment, devices and interfaces that serve or are a part of the lighting subsystem in a building

Limit.description: A parameter that places a lower or upper bound on the range of permitted values of a Setpoint.

Liquid.description: state of matter intermediate between crystalline substances and gases in which the volume of a substance, but not the shape, remains relatively constant.

Liquid_CO2.description: Carbon Dioxide in the liquid phase

Load_Current_Sensor.description: Measures the current consumed by a load

Load_Shed_Command.description: Controls load shedding behavior provided by a control system

Load_Shed_Status.description: Indicates if a load shedding policy is in effect

Loading_Dock.description: A part of a facility where delivery trucks can load and unload. Usually partially enclosed with specific traffic lanes leading to the dock

Lobby.description: A space just after the entrance to a building or other space of a building, where visitors can wait

Lockout_Status.description: Indicates if a piece of equipment, system, or functionality has been locked out from operation

Loop.description: A collection of connected equipment; part of a System

Lounge.description: A room for lesiure activities or relaxing

Louver.description: Device consisting of an assembly of parallel sloping vanes, intended to permit the passage of air while providing a measure of protection against environmental influences

Low_Humidity_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates low concentration of water vapor in the air.

Low_Humidity_Alarm_Parameter.description: A parameter determining the humidity level at which to trigger a low humidity alarm

Low_Outside_Air_Lockout_Temperature_Diff.description: The lower bound of the outside air temperature lockout range

Low_Return_Air_Temperature_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates that return air temperature is too low

Low_Suction_Pressure_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates a low suction pressure in the compressor in a refrigeration or air conditioning system.

Low_Temperature_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates low temperature.

Low_Temperature_Alarm_Parameter.description: A parameter determining the temperature level at which to trigger a low temperature alarm

Lowest_Exhaust_Air_Static_Pressure_Senso.description: The lowest observed static pressure of air in exhaust regions of an HVAC system over some period of time

Luminaire.description: A complete lighting unit consisting of a lamp or lamps and ballast(s) (when applicable) together with the parts designed to distribute the light, to position and protect the lamps, and to connect the lamps to the power supply.

Luminaire_Driver.description: A power source for a luminaire

Luminance_Command.description: Controls the amount of luminance delivered by a lighting system

Luminance_Sensor.description: Measures the luminous intensity per unit area of light travelling in a given direction

MDF.description: A room for the Main Distribution Frame, the central place of a building where cables carrying signals meet and connect to the outside world

Mail_Room.description: A room where mail is recieved and sorted for distribution to the rest of the building

Maintenance_Mode_Command.description: Controls whether or not a device or controller is operating in "Maintenance" mode

Maintenance_Required_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates that repair/maintenance is required on an associated device or equipment

Majlis.description: In Arab countries, an Majlis is a private lounge where visitors are recieved and entertained

Makeup_Air_Unit.description: A device designed to condition ventilation air introduced into a space or to replace air exhausted from a process or general area exhaust. The device may be used to prevent negative pressure within buildings or to reduce airborne contaminants in a space.

Makeup_Water.description: Water used used to makeup water loss through leaks, evaporation, or blowdown

Makeup_Water_Valve.description: A valve regulating the flow of makeup water into a water holding tank, e.g. a cooling tower, hot water tank

Manual_Auto_Status.description: Indicates if a system is under manual or automatic operation

Massage_Room.description: Usually adjunct to an athletic facility, a private/semi-private space where massages are performed
