Min_Unoccupied_Cooling_Supply_Air_Flow_S.description: A parameter that places a lower bound on the range of permitted values of a Unoccupied_Cooling_Supply_Air_Flow_Setpoint.

Min_Unoccupied_Heating_Discharge_Air_Flo.description: A parameter that places a lower bound on the range of permitted values of a Unoccupied_Heating_Discharge_Air_Flow_Setpoint.

Min_Unoccupied_Heating_Supply_Air_Flow_S.description: A parameter that places a lower bound on the range of permitted values of a Unoccupied_Heating_Supply_Air_Flow_Setpoint.

Min_Water_Level_Alarm.description: Alarm indicating that the minimum water level was reached

Mixed_Air.description: (1) air that contains two or more streams of air. (2) combined outdoor air and recirculated air.

Mixed_Air_Filter.description: A filter that is applied to the mixture of recirculated and outside air

Mixed_Air_Humidity_Sensor.description: Measures the humidity of mixed air

Mixed_Air_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the temperature of mixed air

Mixed_Damper.description: A damper that modulates the flow of the mixed outside and return air streams

Mode_Command.description: Controls the operating mode of a device or controller

Mode_Status.description: Indicates which mode a system, device or control loop is currently in

Motion_Sensor.description: Detects the presence of motion in some area

Motor.description: A machine in which power is applied to do work by the conversion of various forms of energy into mechanical force and motion.

Motor_Control_Center.description: The Motor Control Center is a specialized type of switchgear which provides electrical power to major mechanical systems in the building such as HVAC components.

Motor_Current_Sensor.description: Measures the current consumed by a motor

Motor_Direction_Status.description: Indicates which direction a motor is operating in, e.g. forward or reverse

Motor_Torque_Sensor.description: Measures the torque, or rotating power, of a motor

NO2_Concentration.label: PM10Concentration
NO2_Concentration.description: The concentration of nitrogen dioxide in a medium

NO2_Level_Sensor.description: Measures the concentration of NO2 in air

Natural_Gas.description: Fossil fuel energy source consisting largely of methane and other hydrocarbons

Natural_Gas_Boiler.description: A closed, pressure vessel that uses natural gas for heating water or other fluids to supply steam or hot water for heating, humidification, or other applications.

No_Water_Alarm.description: Alarm indicating that there is no water in the equipment or system

Noncondensing_Natural_Gas_Boiler.description: A closed, pressure vessel that uses natural gas with no system to capture latent heat for heating water or other fluids to supply steam or hot water for heating, humidification, or other applications.

Occupancy_Command.description: Controls whether or not a device or controller is operating in "Occupied" mode

Occupancy_Count.label: Occupancy_Count
Occupancy_Count.description: Number of people in an area

Occupancy_Percentage.label: Occupancy_Percentage
Occupancy_Percentage.description: Percent of total occupancy of space that is occupied

Occupancy_Sensor.description: Detects occupancy of some space or area

Occupancy_Status.description: Indicates if a room or space is occupied

Occupied_Cooling_Discharge_Air_Flow_Setp.description: Sets discharge air flow for cooling when occupied

Occupied_Cooling_Supply_Air_Flow_Setpoin.description: Sets supply air flow rate for cooling when occupied

Occupied_Cooling_Temperature_Deadband_Se.description: Sets the size of a deadband of temperature for cooling when occupied

Occupied_Discharge_Air_Flow_Setpoint.description: Sets discharge air flow when occupied

Occupied_Heating_Discharge_Air_Flow_Setp.description: Sets discharge air flow for heating when occupied

Occupied_Heating_Supply_Air_Flow_Setpoin.description: Sets supply air flow rate for heating when occupied

Occupied_Heating_Temperature_Deadband_Se.description: Sets the size of a deadband of temperature for heating when occupied

Occupied_Mode_Status.description: Indicates if a system, device or control loop is in "Occupied" mode

Occupied_Supply_Air_Flow_Setpoint.description: Sets supply air flow rate when occupied

Off_Command.description: An Off Command controls or reports the binary 'off' status of a control loop, relay or equipment activity. It can only be used to stop/deactivate an associated equipment or process, or determine that the related entity is 'off'

Off_Status.description: Indicates if a control loop, relay or equipment is off

Office.description: A class of rooms dedicated for work or study

Office_Kitchen.description: A common space, usually near or in a breakroom, where minor food preperation occurs

Oil.description: a viscous liquid derived from petroleum, especially for use as a fuel or lubricant.

On_Command.description: An On Command controls or reports the binary 'on' status of a control loop, relay or equipment activity. It can only be used to start/activate an associated equipment or process, or determine that the related entity is 'on'

On_Off_Command.description: An On/Off Command controls or reports the binary status of a control loop, relay or equipment activity

On_Off_Status.description: Indicates the on/off status of a control loop, relay or equipment

On_Status.description: Indicates if a control loop, relay or equipment is on

On_Timer_Sensor.description: Measures the duration for which a device was in an active or "on" state

Open_Close_Status.description: Indicates the open/close status of a device such as a damper or valve

Open_Office.description: An open space used for work or study by mulitple people. Usuaully subdivided into cubicles or desks

Operating_Mode_Status.description: Indicates the current operating mode of a system, device or control loop

Operative_Temperature.label: Operative_Temperature
Operative_Temperature.description: The uniform temperature of an imaginary black enclosure in which an occupant would exchange the same amount of heat by radiation plus convection as in the actual nonuniform environment (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Operative_temperature)

Outdoor_Area.description: A class of spaces that exist outside of a building

Output_Voltage_Sensor.description: Measures the voltage output by some process or device

Outside_Air.description: air external to a defined zone (e.g., corridors).

Outside_Air_CO2_Sensor.description: Measures the concentration of CO2 in outside air

Outside_Air_CO_Sensor.description: Measures the concentration of CO in outside air

Outside_Air_Dewpoint_Sensor.description: Senses the dewpoint temperature of outside air

Outside_Air_Enthalpy_Sensor.description: Measures the total heat content of outside air

Outside_Air_Flow_Sensor.description: Measures the rate of flow of outside air into the system

Outside_Air_Grains_Sensor.description: Measures the mass of water vapor in outside air

Outside_Air_Humidity_Sensor.description: Measures the relative humidity of outside air

Outside_Air_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the temperature of outside air

Outside_Air_Wet_Bulb_Temperature_Sensor.description: A sensor measuring the wet-bulb temperature of outside air

Outside_Damper.description: A damper that modulates the flow of outside air

Outside_Face_Surface_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the outside surface (relative to the space) of the radiant panel of a radiant heating and cooling HVAC system.

Outside_Face_Surface_Temperature_Setpoin.description: Sets temperature for the outside face surface temperature of the radiant panel.

Outside_Illuminance_Sensor.description: Measures the total luminous flux incident on an outside, per unit area

Overload_Alarm.description: An alarm that can indicate when a full-load current is exceeded.

Overridden_Off_Status.description: Indicates if a control loop, relay or equipment has been turned off when it would otherwise be scheduled to be on

Overridden_On_Status.description: Indicates if a control loop, relay or equipment has been turned on when it would otherwise be scheduled to be off

Overridden_Status.description: Indicates if the expected operating status of an equipment or control loop has been overridden

Override_Command.description: Controls or reports whether or not a device or control loop is in 'override'

Ozone_Concentration.label: OzoneConcentration
Ozone_Concentration.description: The concentration of ozone in a medium

Ozone_Level_Sensor.description: Measures the concentration of ozone in air

PAU.description: A type of AHU, use to pre-treat the outdoor air before feed to AHU

PIR_Sensor.description: Detects the presense of motion in some area using the differential change in infrared intensity between two or more receptors

PM10_Concentration.label: PM10Concentration
PM10_Concentration.description: The concentration of particulates with diameter of 10 microns or less in air

PM10_Level_Sensor.description: Detects level of particulates of size 10 microns

PM1_Concentration.label: PM1Concentration
PM1_Concentration.description: The concentration of particulates with diameter of 1 microns or less in air

PM1_Level_Sensor.description: Detects level of particulates of size 1 micron

PM2.5_Concentration.label: PM2.5Concentration
PM2.5_Concentration.description: The concentration of particulates with diameter of 2.5 microns or less in air

PM2.5_Level_Sensor.description: Detects level of particulates of size 2.5 microns

PVT_Panel.description: A type of solar panels that convert solar radiation into usable thermal and electrical energy

PV_Generation_System.description: A collection of photovoltaic devices that generates energy

PV_Panel.description: An integrated assembly of interconnected photovoltaic cells designed to deliver a selected level of working voltage and current at its output terminals packaged for protection against environment degradation and suited for incorporation in photovoltaic power systems.

Parameter.description: Parameter points are configuration settings used to guide the operation of equipment and control systems; for example they may provide bounds on valid setpoint values

Parking_Level.description: A floor of a parking structure

Parking_Space.description: An area large enough to park an individual vehicle

Parking_Structure.description: A building or part of a building devoted to vehicle parking

Particulate_Matter_Sensor.description: Detects pollutants in the ambient air

Peak_Power.label: PeakPower
Peak_Power.description: Tracks the highest (peak) observed power in some interval

Peak_Power_Demand_Sensor.description: The peak power consumed by a process over some period of time

Photovoltaic_Current_Output_Sensor.description: Senses the amperes of electrical current produced as output by a photovoltaic device

Piezoelectric_Sensor.description: Senses changes pressure, acceleration, temperature, force or strain via the piezoelectric effect

PlugStrip.description: A device containing a block of electrical sockets allowing multiple electrical devices to be powered from a single electrical socket.

Plumbing_Room.description: A service room devoted to the operation and routing of water in a building. Usually distinct from the HVAC subsystems.

Position.label: Position
Position.description: The fraction of the full range of motion

Position_Command.description: Controls or reports the position of some object

Position_Limit.description: A parameter that places a lower or upper bound on the range of permitted values of a Position_Setpoint.

Position_Sensor.description: Measures the current position of a component in terms of a fraction of its full range of motion

Potable_Water.description: Water that is safe to drink

Power.description: Power is the rate at which work is performed or energy is transmitted, or the amount of energy required or expended for a given unit of time. As a rate of change of work done or the energy of a subsystem, power is: (P = W/t), where (P) is power, (W) is work and {t} is time.

Power_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates the off-normal conditions associated with electrical power.

Power_Factor.description: Power Factor, under periodic conditions, is the ratio of the absolute value of the active power (P) to the apparent power (S).

Power_Loss_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates a power failure.

Power_Sensor.description: Measures the amount of instantaneous power consumed

Prayer_Room.description: A room set aside for prayer

Pre_Filter.description: A filter installed in front of a more efficient filter to extend the life of the more expensive higher efficiency filter

Pre_Filter_Status.description: Indicates if a prefilter needs to be replaced

Precipitation.label: Precipitation
Precipitation.description: Amount of atmospheric water vapor fallen including rain, sleet, snow, and hail (https://project-haystack.dev/doc/lib-phScience/precipitation)

Preheat_Demand_Setpoint.description: Sets the rate required for preheat

Preheat_Discharge_Air_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the temperature of discharge air before heating is applied

Preheat_Supply_Air_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the temperature of supply air before it is heated

Pressure_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates the off-normal conditions associated with pressure.

Pressure_Sensor.description: Measure the amount of force acting on a unit area

Pressure_Status.description: Indicates if pressure is within expected bounds

Private_Office.description: An office devoted to a single individual, with walls and door

Pump.description: Machine for imparting energy to a fluid, causing it to do work, drawing a fluid into itself through an entrance port, and forcing the fluid out through an exhaust port.

Pump_Command.description: Controls or reports the speed of a pump (typically as a proportion of its full pumping capacity)

Pump_Room.description: A mechanical room that houses pumps

Radiant_Ceiling_Panel.description: Radiant panel heating and cooling system that are usually made from metal and suspended under the ceiling or insulated from the building structure.

Radiant_Panel.description: A temperature-controlled surface that provides fifty percent (50%) or more of the design heat transfer by thermal radiation.

Radiant_Panel_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the temperature of the radiant panel of the radiant heating and cooling HVAC system.

Radiant_Temperature.label: Radiant_Temperature
Radiant_Temperature.description: the uniform temperature of an imaginary enclosure in which the radiant heat transfer from the human body is equal to the radiant heat transfer in the actual non-uniform enclosure. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mean_radiant_temperature)

Radiator.description: Heat exchangers designed to transfer thermal energy from one medium to another

Radon_Concentration.label: RadonConcentration
Radon_Concentration.description: The concentration of radioactivity due to Radon in a medium

Radon_Concentration_Sensor.description: Measures the concentration of radioactivity due to radon

Rain_Duration_Sensor.description: Measures the duration of precipitation within some time frame

Rain_Sensor.description: Measures the amount of precipitation fallen

Reactive_Power.description: Reactive Power}, for a linear two-terminal element or two-terminal circuit, under sinusoidal conditions, is the quantity equal to the product of the apparent power (S) and the sine of the displacement angle (\psi). The absolute value of the reactive power is equal to the non-active power. The ISO (and SI) unit for reactive power is the voltampere. The special name var and symbol \textit{var are given in IEC 60027 1.

Reactive_Power_Sensor.description: Measures the portion of power that, averaged over a complete cycle of the AC waveform, is due to stored energy which returns to the source in each cycle

Real_Power.description: (Active Power) is, under periodic conditions, the mean value, taken over one period (T), of the instantaneous power (p). In complex notation, (P = Re \; S), where (S) is (complex power)".

Reception.description: A space, usually in a lobby, where visitors to a building or space can go to after arriving at a building and inform building staff that they have arrived

Region.description: A unit of geographic space, usually contigious or somehow related to a geopolitical feature

Reheat_Valve.description: A valve that controls air temperature by modulating the amount of hot water flowing through a reheat coil

Relative_Humidity.description: Relative Humidity} is the ratio of the partial pressure of water vapor in an air-water mixture to the saturated vapor pressure of water at a prescribed temperature. The relative humidity of air depends not only on temperature but also on the pressure of the system of interest. Relative Humidity is also referred to as \text{Relative Partial Pressure. Relative partial pressure is often referred to as (RH) and expressed in percent.

Relative_Humidity_Sensor.description: Measures the present state of absolute humidity relative to a maximum humidity given the same temperature

Reset_Command.description: Commands that reset a flag, property or value to its default

Rest_Room.description: A room that provides toilets and washbowls. Alternate spelling of Restroom

Restroom.description: A room that provides toilets and washbowls.

Retail_Room.description: A space set aside for retail in a larger establishment, e.g. a gift shop in a hospital

Return_Air.description: air removed from a space to be recirculated or exhausted. Air extracted from a space and totally or partially returned to an air conditioner, furnace, or other heating, cooling, or ventilating system.

Return_Air_CO2_Sensor.description: Measures the concentration of CO2 in return air

Return_Air_CO2_Setpoint.description: Sets some property of CO2 in Return Air

Return_Air_CO_Sensor.description: Measures the concentration of CO in return air

Return_Air_Dewpoint_Sensor.description: Senses the dewpoint temperature of return air

Return_Air_Differential_Pressure_Sensor.description: Measures the difference in pressure between the return and supply side

Return_Air_Differential_Pressure_Setpoin.description: Sets the target air differential pressure between an upstream and downstream point in a return air duct or conduit

Return_Air_Enthalpy_Sensor.description: Measures the total heat content of return air

Return_Air_Flow_Sensor.description: Measures the rate of flow of return air

Return_Air_Grains_Sensor.description: Measures the mass of water vapor in return air

Return_Air_Humidity_Sensor.description: Measures the relative humidity of return air

Return_Air_Plenum.description: A component of the HVAC the receives air from the room to recirculate or exhaust to or from the building

Return_Air_Temperature_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates the off-normal conditions associated with the temperature of return air.

Return_Air_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the temperature of return air

Return_Air_Temperature_Setpoint.description: The target temperature for return air, often used as an approximation of zone air temperature

Return_Chilled_Water_Temperature_Setpoin.description: Sets the temperature of return (downstream of the chilled water load) chilled water

Return_Condenser_Water.description: In a condenser water loop, this is water being brought away from the condenser side of a heat-rejection device (e.g. chiller). It is the 'warm' side.

Return_Condenser_Water_Flow_Sensor.description: Measures the flow of the return condenser water

Return_Condenser_Water_Temperature_Senso.description: Measures the temperature of the return condenser water

Return_Damper.description: A damper that modulates the flow of return air

Return_Fan.description: Fan moving return air -- air that is circulated from the building back into the HVAC system

Return_Heating_Valve.description: A valve installed on the return side of a heat exchanger

Return_Hot_Water_Temperature_Setpoint.description: Sets the temperature of return (downstream of the hot water load) hot water

Return_Water.description: The water is a system after it is used in a heat transfer cycle

Return_Water_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the temperature of return water

Return_Water_Temperature_Setpoint.description: Sets the temperature of return water

Riser.description: A vertical shaft indented for installing building infrastructure e.g., electrical wire, network communication wire, plumbing, etc

Rooftop_Unit.description: Packaged air conditioner mounted on a roof, the conditioned air being discharged directly into the rooms below or through a duct system.

Room.description: Base class for all more specific room types.

Run_Request_Status.description: Indicates if a request has been filed to start a device or equipment

Run_Time_Sensor.description: Measures the duration for which a device was in an active or "on" state

Sash_Position_Sensor.description: Measures the current position of a sash in terms of the percent of fully open

Schedule_Temperature_Setpoint.description: The current setpoint as indicated by the schedule

Security_Service_Room.description: A class of spaces used by the security staff of a facility

Sensor.description: A Sensor is an input point that represents the value of a device or instrument designed to detect and measure a variable (ASHRAE Dictionary).

Service_Room.description: A class of spaces related to the operations of building subsystems, e.g. HVAC, electrical, IT, plumbing, etc

Setpoint.description: A Setpoint is an input value at which the desired property is set

Shading_System.description: Devices that can control daylighting through various means

Shared_Office.description: An office used by multiple people

Short_Cycle_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates a short cycle occurred. A short cycle occurs when a cooling cycle is prevented from completing its full cycle

Shower.description: A space containing showers, usually adjacent to an athletic or execise area

Site.description: A geographic region containing 0 or more buildings. Typically used as the encapsulating location for a collection of Brick entities through the hasSite/isSiteOf relationships

Smoke_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates the off-normal conditions associated with smoke.

Solar_Azimuth_Angle_Sensor.description: Measures the azimuth angle of the sun

Solar_Irradiance.label: SolarIrradiance
Solar_Irradiance.description: The power per unit area of solar electromagnetic radiation incident on a surface

Solar_Radiance.label: Solar_Radiance
Solar_Radiance.description: The amount of light that passes through or is emitted from the sun and falls within a given solid angle in a specified direction

Solar_Radiance_Sensor.description: The amount of light that passes through or is emitted from the sun and falls within a given solid angle in a specified direction

Solar_Thermal_Collector.description: A type of solar panels that converts solar radiation into thermal energy.

Solar_Zenith_Angle_Sensor.description: Measures the zenith angle of the sun

Solid.description: one of the three states or phases of matter characterized by stability of dimensions, relative incompressibility, and molecular motion held to limited oscillation.

Space.description: A part of the physical world or a virtual world whose 3D spatial extent is bounded actually or theoretically, and provides for certain functions within the zone it is contained in.

Space_Heater.description: A heater used to warm the air in an enclosed area, such as a room or office

Speed_Sensor.description: Measures the magnitude of velocity of some form of movement

Speed_Setpoint_Limit.description: A parameter that places a lower or upper bound on the range of permitted values of a Speed_Setpoint.

Speed_Status.description: Indicates the operating speed of a device or equipment, e.g. fan

Sports_Service_Room.description: A class of spaces used in the support of sports

Stage_Enable_Command.description: A point representing a discrete stage which the equipment should be operating at. The desired stage number should be identified by an entity property

Stage_Riser.description: A low platform in a space or on a stage

Stages_Status.description: Indicates which stage a control loop or equipment is in

Standby_CRAC.description: A CRAC that is activated as part of a lead/lag operation or when an alarm occurs in a primary unit

Standby_Fan.description: Fan that is activated as part of a lead/lag operation or when a primary fan raises an alarm

Standby_Glycool_Unit_On_Off_Status.description: Indicates the on/off status of a standby glycool unit

Standby_Unit_On_Off_Status.description: Indicates the on/off status of a standby unit

Start_Stop_Command.description: A Start/Stop Command controls or reports the active/inactive status of a control sequence

Start_Stop_Status.description: Indicates the active/inactive status of a control loop (but not equipment activities or relays -- use On/Off for this purpose)

Static_Pressure_Deadband_Setpoint.description: Sets the size of a deadband of static pressure

Static_Pressure_Sensor.description: Measures resistance to airflow in a heating and cooling system's components and duct work

Static_Pressure_Setpoint_Limit.description: A parameter that places a lower or upper bound on the range of permitted values of a Static_Pressure_Setpoint.

Status.description: A Status is input point that reports the current operating mode, state, position, or condition of an item. Statuses are observations and should be considered 'read-only'

Steam_Baseboard_Radiator.description: Steam heating device located at or near the floor

Steam_Distribution.description: Utilize a steam distribution source to represent how steam is distributed across multiple destinations

Steam_System.description: The equipment, devices and conduits that handle the production and distribution of steam in a building

Steam_Usage_Sensor.description: Measures the amount of steam that is consumed or used, over some period of time

Storage_Room.description: A class of spaces used for storage

Studio.description: A room used for the production or media, usually with either a specialized set or a specialized sound booth for recording

Supply_Air.description: (1) air delivered by mechanical or natural ventilation to a space, composed of any combination of outdoor air, recirculated air, or transfer air. (2) air entering a space from an air-conditioning, heating, or ventilating apparatus for the purpose of comfort conditioning. Supply air is generally filtered, fan forced, and either heated, cooled, humidified, or dehumidified as necessary to maintain specified conditions. Only the quantity of outdoor air within the supply airflow may be used as replacement air.

Supply_Air_Differential_Pressure_Sensor.description: Measures the difference in pressure between an upstream and downstream of an air duct or other air conduit used to supply air into the building

Supply_Air_Differential_Pressure_Setpoin.description: Sets the target air differential pressure between an upstream and downstream point in a supply air duct or conduit

Supply_Air_Duct_Pressure_Status.description: Indicates if air pressure in supply duct is within expected bounds

Supply_Air_Flow_Demand_Setpoint.description: Sets the rate of supply air flow required for a process

Supply_Air_Flow_Sensor.description: Measures the rate of flow of supply air

Supply_Air_Humidity_Sensor.description: Measures the relative humidity of supply air

Supply_Air_Plenum.description: A component of the HVAC the receives air from the air handling unit to distribute to the building

Supply_Air_Static_Pressure_Deadband_Setp.description: Sets the size of a deadband of static pressure of supply air

Supply_Air_Static_Pressure_Sensor.description: The static pressure of air within supply regions of an HVAC system

Supply_Air_Static_Pressure_Setpoint.description: Sets static pressure of supply air

Supply_Air_Temperature_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates the off-normal conditions associated with the temperature of supply air.

Supply_Air_Temperature_Deadband_Setpoint.description: Sets the size of a deadband of temperature of supply air

Supply_Air_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the temperature of supply air

Supply_Chilled_Water_Temperature_Setpoin.description: Temperature setpoint for supply chilled water

Supply_Condenser_Water.description: In a condenser water loop, this is water being brought to the condenser side of a heat-rejection device (e.g. chiller). It is the 'cold' side.

Supply_Condenser_Water_Flow_Sensor.description: Measures the flow of the supply condenser water

Supply_Condenser_Water_Temperature_Senso.description: Measures the temperature of the supply condenser water

Supply_Condenser_Water_Temperature_Setpo.description: The temperature setpoint for the supply condenser water

Supply_Fan.description: Fan moving supply air -- air that is supplied from the HVAC system into the building

Supply_Hot_Water_Temperature_Setpoint.description: Temperature setpoint for supply hot water

Supply_Water_Differential_Pressure_Deadb.description: Sets the size of a deadband of differential pressure of supply water

Supply_Water_Flow_Sensor.description: Measures the rate of flow of hot supply water

Supply_Water_Flow_Setpoint.description: Sets the flow rate of hot supply water

Supply_Water_Temperature_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates the off-normal conditions associated with temperature of the supply water.

Supply_Water_Temperature_Deadband_Setpoi.description: Sets the size of a deadband of temperature of supply water

Switch.description: A switch used to operate all or part of a lighting installation

Switch_Room.description: A telecommuncations room housing network switches

Switchgear.description: A main disconnect or service disconnect feeds power to a switchgear, which then distributes power to the rest of the building through smaller amperage-rated disconnects.

System.description: A System is a combination of equipment and auxiliary devices (e.g., controls, accessories, interconnecting means, and termi­nal elements) by which energy is transformed so it performs a specific function such as HVAC, service water heating, or lighting. (ASHRAE Dictionary).

System_Shutdown_Status.description: Indicates if a system has been shutdown

System_Status.description: Indicates properties of the activity of a system

TETRA_Room.description: A room used for local two-way radio networks, e.g. the portable radios carried by facilities staff

TVOC_Concentration.label: TVOCConcentration
TVOC_Concentration.description: The concentration of total volatile organic compounds in air

TVOC_Level_Sensor.description: A sensor measuring the level of all VOCs in air

Team_Room.description: An office used by multiple team members for specific work tasks. Distinct from Conference Room

Telecom_Room.description: A class of spaces used to support telecommuncations and IT equipment

Temperature_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates the off-normal conditions associated with temperature.

Temperature_Deadband_Setpoint.description: Sets the size of a deadband of temperature

Temperature_Parameter.description: Parameters relevant to temperature-related systems and points

Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures temperature: the physical property of matter that quantitatively expresses the common notions of hot and cold

Temperature_Tolerance_Parameter.description: A parameter determining the difference between upper and lower limits of temperature.

Temporary_Occupancy_Status.description: For systems that differentiate between scheduled occupied/unoccupied mode, this indicates if a space is temporarily occupied when it would otherwise be unoccupied

Terminal_Unit.description: A device that regulates the volumetric flow rate and/or the temperature of the controlled medium.

Thermal_Energy.description: Thermal Energy} is the portion of the thermodynamic or internal energy of a system that is responsible for the temperature of the system. From a macroscopic thermodynamic description, the thermal energy of a system is given by its constant volume specific heat capacity C(T), a temperature coefficient also called thermal capacity, at any given absolute temperature (T): (U_{thermal = C(T) \cdot T).

Thermally_Activated_Building_System_Pane.description: Radiant panel heating and cooling system where the energy heat source or sink is embedded in the building structure such as in slabs and walls.

Thermostat.description: An automatic control device used to maintain temperature at a fixed or adjustable setpoint.

Ticketing_Booth.description: A room or space used to sell or distribute tickets to events at a venue

TimeseriesReference.description: Metadata describing where and how the data for a Brick Point is stored

Tolerance_Parameter.description: difference between upper and lower limits of size for a given nominal dimension or value.

Torque.description: In physics, a torque (τ) is a vector that measures the tendency of a force to rotate an object about some axis. The magnitude of a torque is defined as force times its lever arm. Just as a force is a push or a pull, a torque can be thought of as a twist. The SI unit for torque is newton meters ((N m)). In U.S. customary units, it is measured in foot pounds (ft lbf) (also known as "pounds feet"). Mathematically, the torque on a particle (which has the position r in some reference frame) can be defined as the cross product: (τ = r x F) where, r is the particle's position vector relative to the fulcrum  F is the force acting on the particles,  or, more generally, torque can be defined as the rate of change of angular momentum: (τ = dL/dt) where, L is the angular momentum vector  t stands for time.

Torque_Sensor.description: Measures torque, the tendency of a force to rotate an object about some axis

Touchpanel.description: A switch used to operate all or part of a lighting installation that uses a touch-based mechanism (typically resistive or capacitive) rather than a mechanical actuator

Trace_Heat_Sensor.description: Measures the surface temperature of pipelines carrying temperature-sensitive products; typically used to avoid frosting/freezing

Transformer.description: A Transformer is usually fed by a high-voltage source and then steps down the voltage to a lower-voltage feed for low-voltage application (such as lights). Transformers also can step up voltage, but this generally does not apply to in building distribution.

Transformer_Room.description: An electrical room where electricity enters and is transformed to different voltages and currents by the equipment contained in the room

Tunnel.description: An enclosed space that connects buildings. Often underground

Underfloor_Air_Plenum.description: An open space between a structural concrete slab and the underside of a raised access floor system that connects to an air handling unit to receive conditioned and/or ventilating air before delivery to the room(s)

Underfloor_Air_Plenum_Static_Pressure_Se.description: Measures the outward push of air against the plenum surfaces and used to measure the resistance when air moves through the plenum
Sets the underfloor air plenum static pressure

Underfloor_Air_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the temperature of underfloor air

Unit_Failure_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates the failure of an equipment or device

Unoccupied_Air_Temperature_Cooling_Setpo.description: Sets temperature of air when unoccupied for cooling

Unoccupied_Air_Temperature_Heating_Setpo.description: Sets temperature of air when unoccupied for heating

Unoccupied_Air_Temperature_Setpoint.description: Sets temperature of air when unoccupied

Unoccupied_Cooling_Discharge_Air_Flow_Se.description: Sets discharge air flow for cooling when unoccupied

Usage_Sensor.description: Measures the amount of some substance that is consumed or used, over some period of time

VFD.description: Electronic device that varies its output frequency to vary the rotating speed of a motor, given a fixed input frequency. Used with fans or pumps to vary the flow in the system as a function of a maintained pressure.

VFD_Enable_Command.description: Enables operation of a variable frequency drive

Valve.description: A device that regulates, directs or controls the flow of a fluid by opening, closing or partially obstructing various passageways

Valve_Command.description: Controls or reports the openness of a valve (typically as a proportion of its full range of motion)

Valve_Position_Sensor.description: Measures the current position of a valve in terms of the percent of fully open

Variable_Air_Volume_Box.description: A device that regulates the volume and temperature of air delivered to a zone by opening or closing a damper

Variable_Air_Volume_Box_With_Reheat.description: A VAV box with a reheat coil mounted on the discharge end of the unit that can heat the air delivered to a zone

Variable_Frequency_Drive.description: Electronic device that varies its output frequency to vary the rotating speed of a motor, given a fixed input frequency. Used with fans or pumps to vary the flow in the system as a function of a maintained pressure.

Velocity_Pressure.description: Dynamic Pressure (indicated with q, or Q, and sometimes called velocity pressure) is the quantity defined by: (q = 1/2 * ρ v^{2}), where (using SI units),  (q) is dynamic pressure in (pascals), (ρ) is fluid density in (kg/m^{3}) (for example, density of air) and (v ) is fluid velocity in (m/s).

Velocity_Pressure_Sensor.description: Measures the difference between total pressure and static pressure

Vent_Operating_Mode_Status.description: Indicates the current operating mode of a vent

Ventilation_Air_Flow_Ratio_Limit.description: A parameter that places a lower or upper bound on the range of permitted values of a Ventilation_Air_Flow_Ratio_Setpoint.

Ventilation_Air_System.description: The equipment, devices, and conduits that handle the introduction and distribution of ventilation air in the building

Vertical_Space.description: A class of spaces used to connect multiple floors or levels..

Visitor_Lobby.description: A lobby for visitors to the building. Sometimes used to distinguish from an employee entrance looby

Voltage.description: Voltage, also referred to as Electric Tension, is the difference between electrical potentials of two points. For an electric field within a medium, (U_{ab} = - \int_{r_a}^{r_b} E . {dr}), where (E) is electric field strength. For an irrotational electric field, the voltage is independent of the path between the two points (a) and (b).

Voltage_Imbalance.label: VoltageImbalance
Voltage_Imbalance.description: The percent deviation from average voltage

Voltage_Imbalance_Sensor.description: A sensor which measures the voltage difference (imbalance) between phases of an electrical system

Voltage_Sensor.description: Measures the voltage of an electrical device or object

Wardrobe.description: Storage for clothing, costumes, or uniforms

Warm_Cool_Adjust_Sensor.description: User provided adjustment of zone temperature, typically in the range of +/- 5 degrees

Warmest_Zone_Air_Temperature_Sensor.description: The zone temperature that is warmest; drives the supply temperature of cold air. A computed value rather than a physical sensor. Also referred to as a 'Highest Zone Air Temperature Sensor'

Waste_Storage.description: A room used for storing waste such as trash or recycling

Water.description: transparent, odorless, tasteless liquid; a compound of hydrogen and oxygen (H2O), containing 11.188% hydrogen and 88.812% oxygen by mass; freezing at 32°F (0°C); boiling near 212°F (100°C).

Water_Alarm.description: Alarm that indicates an undesirable event with a pipe, container, or equipment carrying water e.g. water leak

Water_Differential_Pressure_Setpoint.description: Sets the target water differential pressure between an upstream and downstream point in a water pipe or conduit

Water_Differential_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the difference in water temperature between an upstream and downstream point in a pipe or conduit

Water_Differential_Temperature_Setpoint.description: Sets the target differential temperature between the start and end of a heat transfer cycle in a water circuit

Water_Distribution.description: Utilize a water distribution source to represent how water is distributed across multiple destinations (pipes)

Water_Flow_Sensor.description: Measures the rate of flow of water

Water_Flow_Setpoint.description: Sets the target flow rate of water

Water_Heater.description: An apparatus for heating and usually storing hot water

Water_Level_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates a high or low water level e.g. in a basin

Water_Level_Sensor.description: Measures the height/level of water in some container

Water_Loop.description: A collection of equipment that transport and regulate water among each other

Water_Loss_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates a loss of water e.g. during transport

Water_Meter.description: A meter that measures the usage or consumption of water

Water_Pump.description: A pump that performs work on water

Water_System.description: The equipment, devices and conduits that handle the production and distribution of water in a building

Water_Tank.description: A space used to hold water

Water_Temperature_Alarm.description: An alarm that indicates the off-normal conditions associated with temperature of water.

Water_Usage_Sensor.description: Measures the amount of water that is consumed, over some period of time

Water_Valve.description: A valve that modulates the flow of water

Wet_Bulb_Temperature.label: Wet_Bulb_Temperature
Wet_Bulb_Temperature.description: The temperature read by a thermometer covered in water-soaked cloth (wet-bulb thermometer) over which air is passed. A wet-bulb thermometer indicates a temperature close to the true (thermodynamic) wet-bulb temperature. The wet-bulb temperature is the lowest temperature that can be reached under current ambient conditions by the evaporation of water only.  DBT is the temperature that is usually thought of as air temperature, and it is the true thermodynamic temperature. It indicates the amount of heat in the air and is directly proportional to the mean kinetic energy of the air molecule. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wet-bulb_temperature)

Wind_Direction.label: Wind_Direction
Wind_Direction.description: Direction of wind relative to North

Wind_Direction_Sensor.description: Measures the direction of wind in degrees relative to North

Wind_Speed.label: Wind_Speed
Wind_Speed.description: Measured speed of wind, caused by air moving from high to low pressure

Wind_Speed_Sensor.description: Measured speed of wind, caused by air moving from high to low pressure

Wing.description: A wing is part of a building – or any feature of a building – that is subordinate to the main, central structure.

Workshop.description: A space used to house equipment that can be used to repair or fabricate things

Zone.description: (1) a separately controlled heated or cooled space. (2) one occupied space or several occupied spaces with similar occupancy category, occupant density, zone air distribution effectiveness, and zone primary airflow per unit area. (3) space or group of spaces within a building for which the heating, cooling, or lighting requirements are sufficiently similar that desired conditions can be maintained throughout by a single controlling device.

Zone_Air.description: air inside a defined zone (e.g., corridors).

Zone_Air_Cooling_Temperature_Setpoint.description: The upper (cooling) setpoint for zone air temperature

Zone_Air_Heating_Temperature_Setpoint.description: The lower (heating) setpoint for zone air temperature

Zone_Air_Humidity_Sensor.description: Measures the relative humidity of zone air

Zone_Air_Temperature_Sensor.description: Measures the temperature of air in a zone

aggregate.description: Description of how the dta for this point is aggregated

azimuth.description: (Horizontal) angle between a projected vector and a reference vector (typically a compass bearing). The projected vector usually indicates the direction of a face or plane.

buildingPrimaryFunction.description: Enumerated string applied to a site record to indicate the building's primary function. The list of primary functions is derived from the US Energy Star program (adopted from Project Haystack)

buildingThermalTransmittance.description: The area-weighted average heat transfer coefficient (commonly referred to as a U-value) for a building envelope

conversionEfficiency.description: The percent efficiency of the conversion process (usually to power or energy) carried out by the entity

coolingCapacity.description: Measurement of a chiller ability to remove heat (adopted from Project Haystack)

coordinates.description: The location of an entity in latitude/longitude

currentFlowType.description: The current flow type of the entity

electricalPhases.description: Entity has these electrical AC phases

feeds.description: The subject is upstream of the object in the context of some sequential process; some media is passed between them

hasAddress.description: To specify the address of a building.

hasAssociatedTag.description: The class is associated with the given tag

hasInputSubstance.description: The subject receives the given substance as an input to its internal process

hasLocation.description: Subject is physically located in the location given by the object

hasOutputSubstance.description: The subject produces or exports the given substance from its internal process

hasPart.description: The subject is composed in part of the entity given by the object

hasPoint.description: The subject has a source of telemetry identified by the object. In some systems the source of telemetry may be represented as a digital/analog input/output point

hasQUDTReference.description: Points to the relevant QUDT definition

hasTag.description: The subject has the given tag

hasTimeseriesId.description: The unique identifier (primary key) for this TimeseriesReference in some database

hasUnit.description: The QUDT unit associated with this Brick entity (usually a Brick Point instance or Entity Property)

isAssociatedWith.description: The tag is associated with the given class

isLocationOf.description: Subject is the physical location encapsulating the object

isPointOf.description: The subject is a source of telemetry related to the object. In some systems the source of telemetry may be represented as a digital/analog input/output point

measuredModuleConversionEfficiency.description: The measured percentage of sunlight that is converted into usable power

measuredPowerOutput.description: The nominal measured power output of the entity

measures.description: The subject measures a quantity or substance given by the object

operationalStageCount.description: The number of operational stages supported by this eqiupment

panelArea.description: Surface area of a panel, such as a PV panel

powerFlow.description: Entity has this power flow relative to the building'

ratedModuleConversionEfficiency.description: The *rated* percentage of sunlight that is converted into usable power, as measured using Standard Test Conditions (STC): 1000 W/sqm irradiance, 25 degC panel temperature, no wind

ratedPowerOutput.description: The nominal rated power output of the entity

regulates.description: The subject contributes to or performs the regulation of the substance given by the object

storedAt.description: A reference to where the data for this TimeseriesReference is stored

temperatureCoefficientofPmax.description: The % change in power output for every degree celsius that the entity is hotter than 25 degrees celsius

thermalTransmittance.description: The area-weighted average heat transfer coefficient (commonly referred to as a U-value)

tilt.description: The direction an entity is facing in degrees above the horizon

timeseries.description: Relates a Brick point to the TimeseriesReference that indicates where and how the data for this point is stored

value.description: The basic value of an entity property

yearBuilt.description: Four digit year that a building was first built. (adopted from Project Haystack)
